comment.author: 64818823@N08
comment._content:
I have been in Kamakura in front of this incredible Daibutsu and it's an iconical and spiritual place for Japan.

I couldn't imagine a group of japanese people climbing a church or another catholic or protestant symbol/monument/temple for a photo at those years in Europe or U.S.A.
In 1860-1900 they'd been put under arrest (or directly murdered in some mediterranean countries).
